title: Indrani Mukherjea to attend yoga, meditation classes
text:
The jail authorities have advised Indrani Mukherjea, the prime accused in the Sheena Bora murder case, to attend the yoga and meditation sessions held in the premises in order to relieve stress. Mukherjea was admitted to JJ hospital on October 2 after she collapsed in her cell. Initial reports had suggested that she had overdosed on anti-depressants.
"We feel yoga and meditation will help the inmate recover faster. She has given her consent and will start attending the classes as soon as she feels better," said additional principal secretary (Prisons) Vijay Satbir Singh.
Singh visited the Byculla women jail on Wednesday to take stock of security and other arrangements, and confirmed meeting Mukerjea, who was shifted back to the prison on Tuesday evening after a five-day stay at JJ hospital.
Singh said the authorities were in the process of upgrading the security system at the jail. "Strict orders have been given vis-a-vis frisking of visitors and maintenance of the visitors book. In the long run, we are also considering increasing the prison capacity," he said.
Meanwhile, sources said that Mukerjea was mostly occupied with reading books and studying her case file. So far, she has been kept in the ordinary cell along with three other inmates.
